intro: Petrophile conifera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clustered, pink or red flowers. This plant is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in well-drained soils, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky areas and provides nectar for native pollinators. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
